meanings.definition: Fubsier (comparative adjective): becoming dirtier or more untidy
meanings.sent1: The old blanket looked fubsier than the new one.
meanings.sent2: The room gets fubsier when the kids play inside.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her brother's room was getting fubsier by the day.
meanings.sent4: The neglected garden grew fubsier with each passing week.
meanings.sent5: The muddy dog made the clean kitchen floor fubsier in seconds.

meanings.definition: Fubsier (adverb): in a manner that is becoming dirtier or more untidy
meanings.sent1: The clothes were piling up fubsier in the laundry basket.
meanings.sent2: She cleaned the house, but it still looked fubsier than before.
meanings.sent3: The wind blew the leaves fubsier across the yard.
meanings.sent4: The rain fell fubsier as the storm grew stronger.
meanings.sent5: The kids played outside, making their clothes fubsier with each jump.

meanings.definition: Fubsier (verb): to make something dirtier or more untidy
meanings.sent1: He accidentally fubsiered his shirt while painting the fence.
meanings.sent2: Please don't fubsier the clean table with your muddy shoes.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to fubsier the neatly arranged papers on the desk.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind fubsiered the carefully raked leaves in the yard.
meanings.sent5: She didn't mean to fubsier the kitchen floor with her muddy boots.
